pellet_density.description: The distribution of regular pac-dots, ensuring the player can create continuous, long-path routes to maximize points and efficiency.

energizer_placement.description: The strategic positioning of the four larger 'energizer' pellets, typically in the corners, creating 'risk vs. reward' zones and temporary safe havens.

dot_collection_path.description: The maze's structure must ensure that eating all dots is an achievable (though not perfectly Eulerian, due to odd vertices) and challenging goal, often requiring repetition of certain paths.

symmetry.description: The map is left-right symmetrical, making the overall navigation and dot-clearing strategy mentally simpler and more balanced.

tunnels.description: Wrap-around tunnels on the left and right edges provide shortcuts or 'escape routes' that temporarily reduce the speed of the ghosts, adding a layer of tactical retreat.

junctions_and_intersections.description: A varied mix of 2-way (corridors), 3-way, and 4-way intersections to create decision points, escape options, and opportunities for 'juke' moves against the ghosts.

ghost_house.description: A central, controlled area where ghosts start and respawn. This area is typically inaccessible to Pac-Man, allowing the ghosts to reset their pursuit.

pacings.description: The map must allow for varying tempos—periods of high-speed chase and low-risk clearing—to create a dynamic flow and pacing in the game.

bottlenecks.description: Narrow corridors or few intersection options in certain areas that create high-risk situations for Pac-Man but allow the ghosts to effectively coordinate their traps.
